poem:
**Morning News**

In the crisp dawn,
the words of a Highland heart
drift down the page—
heather whispers,
kestrels carve the sky.
A brown body, undeterred,
stalks through glens,
bearing witness
to ancient winds.
Ignore the puzzled faces;
feel the earth's pulse,
the solemn branches break—
finding their truth
in every step,
in every glenward path.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Poem of the week: Highland Daunder by Jeda Pearl Highland Daunder Kestrel in ma chest: wheesht yersel —you belang here, amang th gorse n heather. Lat thaim ramble their een ower you —yer broun body stravaigin th glen isnae an unnatural sicht. Ignore their conflummixt n scunnert physogs —thay cannae sense th braken brainches we’in you. Follae that rare spinal path.Moor yersel tae th wasterly winds.Seek oot th juttin headlandsn staund yer graund. Speak wi". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Poem of the week: Highland Daunder by Jeda Pearl Highland Daunder Kestrel in ma chest: wheesht yersel —you belang here, amang th gorse n heather. Lat thaim ramble their een ower you —yer broun body stravaigin th glen isnae an unnatural sicht. Ignore their conflummixt n scunnert physogs —thay cannae sense th braken brainches we’in you. Follae that rare spinal path.Moor yersel tae th wasterly winds.Seek oot th juttin headlandsn staund yer graund. Speak wi
